history.content:
Taking CS170 right now and it eats up around the same amount of time that CS70 did. I would even argue that in someways its easier than CS70; or maybe the material is interesting and the problem sets don't feel artificially difficult. In comparison to CS170, CS188 was a lot less work per week, but note the difficulty from this class comes from the exams, which many underestimate. I took EE16B last semester and overall, there is more work to do than was done for EE16A, but not by much.

If you have a lot of extracurricular activities, then perhaps consider only taking 2/3. Not that its impossible to do all 3, but you stated you wanted to actually learn things in-depth and perhaps not feel overly pressured by deadlines. Your mental health is important too.

-----

Note that 188 and 170 have the same lecture time next semester, and neither class will offer an alternate final time, so you can't take both.

I took EE16B last semester and overall, there is more work to do than was done for EE16A, but not by much.

If you have a lot of extracurricular activities, then perhaps consider only taking 2/3. Not that its impossible to do all 3, but you stated you wanted to actually learn things in-depth and perhaps not feel overly pressured by deadlines. Your mental health is important too.

children.subject: I'm currently taking 170 188 and 61C. It's not too bad as long as you stay on top of your work. I can't imagine adding a single other class though. Still have a social life and get to sleep 8 hours a night. But, I'm basically doing any project/homework/lab as soon as they are released.

history.content:
TLDR: Seems like I should take at least 2/3 of 188/16B/170, but am wondering if there's anything I can replace either 16B or 188 or both with.

For Spring 2018, I'm currently trying to decide which classes to sign up for out of 170, 188, EE 16B, and Ling 100 or Chinese 100XB.

I would be okay with 170/188/16B probably, but I'm also pretty involved in each of 3 extracurricular activities (6 hr/week, 6-8 hr/week, 12 hr/week). I think I need to prioritize taking 170 for internships, and 16B seems like I should get it out of the way, but I'm worried that if I don't take 3 techs next semester it'll be too "little" (lol). 

Background: I'm a second year EECS major & am currently taking 61C, 16A, and Chinese 100XA (lol language classes are like a black hole of time and busy work). Last semester, I took 110, 61B, 70, and a breadth and I pulled a 3.5 for the semester but was hella busy and wanted to be able to actually learn things in-depth, hence the light workload this semester. 

Ling 100/Chinese 100XB would be my last COE requirements though - finished R1A/R1B, Physics 7A/7B, and AC last year/summer. 

Any input would be appreciated! I'm meeting with my faculty advisor next week, but wanted some student advice.
history.subject: 188/16B/170 Next Semester? Advice please
